data.title: webupdate team
Create requirement verifier for script/bootstrap
data.body:
This moves the build verifications to a separate file. It also allows Windows users to set the PYTHON env var if Python27 is not installed in SYSTEM_DRIVE:\Python27.

The PYTHON env var is used by [node-gpy](https://github.com/TooTallNate/node-gyp/blob/56dcb889091a6a0594854ccc517e498b21078d5f/lib/configure.js#L25) to determine the python executable location.

data.title: Atom over sshfs Unusably Slow
data.body: When editing files over an sshfs connection, it takes long periods of time to perform basic actions (directory expansion, file opening).  This is likely because git is running locally, but querying a remote repository many times -- can these behaviors be migrated into a non-blocking request?  e.g., allow the file to open before the git repo has been read for any changes.

data.title: atom.workspace.getActiveEditor() returning editor with no cursors
data.body:
We are seeing a lot of these in bugsnag:

```
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot call method 'getBufferPosition' of undefined
app/src/editor.js:1321:31 Editor.module.exports.Editor.getCursorBufferPosition
app/node_modules/status-bar/lib/cursor-position-view.js:40:46 CursorPositionView.module.exports.CursorPositionView.updateCursorPositionText
app/node_modules/status-bar/lib/cursor-position-view.js:3:61 <anonymous>
app/node_modules/space-pen/vendor/jquery.js:4676:9 jQuery.event.dispatch
app/node_modules/space-pen/vendor/jquery.js:4360:28 elemData.handle
app/node_modules/space-pen/vendor/jquery.js:4594:12 jQuery.event.trigger
app/node_modules/space-pen/vendor/jquery.js:5119:17 <anonymous>
app/node_modules/space-pen/vendor/jquery.js:590:23 Function.jQuery.extend.each
app/node_modules/space-pen/vendor/jquery.js:237:17 StatusBarView.jQuery.fn.jQuery.each
app/node_modules/space-pen/vendor/jquery.js:5118:15 StatusBarView.jQuery.fn.extend.trigger
app/node_modules/status-bar/lib/status-bar-view.js:44:24 <anonymous>
app/node_modules/space-pen/vendor/jquery.js:4676:9 jQuery.event.dispatch
app/node_modules/space-pen/vendor/jquery.js:4360:28 elemData.handle
app/node_modules/space-pen/vendor/jquery.js:4594:12 jQuery.event.trigger
app/node_modules/space-pen/vendor/jquery.js:5119:17 <anonymous>
app/node_modules/space-pen/vendor/jquery.js:590:23 Function.jQuery.extend.each
app/node_modules/space-pen/vendor/jquery.js:237:17 PaneContainerView.jQuery.fn.jQuery.each
app/node_modules/space-pen/vendor/jquery.js:5118:15 PaneContainerView.jQuery.fn.extend.trigger
app/src/pane-container-view.js:87:19 PaneContainerView.module.exports.PaneContainerView.onActivePaneItemChanged
app/node_modules/emissary/lib/emitter.js:132:47 Signal.module.exports.Emitter.emit
app/node_modules/emissary/lib/signal.js:82:19 Signal.module.exports.Signal.emitValue
app/node_modules/emissary/lib/emitter.js:132:47 Behavior.module.exports.Emitter.emit
app/node_modules/emissary/lib/behavior.js:44:38 Behavior.module.exports.Behavior.emit
app/node_modules/emissary/lib/signal.js:82:19 Behavior.module.exports.Signal.emitValue
app/node_modules/emissary/lib/emitter.js:132:47 Behavior.module.exports.Emitter.emit
app/node_modules/emissary/lib/behavior.js:44:38 Behavior.module.exports.Behavior.emit
app/node_modules/emissary/lib/signal.js:82:19 Behavior.module.exports.Signal.emitValue
app/node_modules/emissary/lib/emitter.js:132:47 Behavior.module.exports.Emitter.emit
app/node_modules/emissary/lib/behavior.js:44:38 Behavior.module.exports.Behavior.emit
app/node_modules/emissary/lib/signal.js:82:19 Behavior.module.exports.Signal.emitValue
app/node_modules/theorist/lib/model.js:166:21 Pane.module.exports.Model.set
app/node_modules/theorist/lib/model.js:57:23 Pane.accessor.set
app/src/pane.js:175:32 Pane.module.exports.Pane.activateItem
app/node_modules/delegato/lib/delegator.js:67:61 PaneView._results.push._this.(anonymous function) [as activateItem]
app/node_modules/tabs/lib/tab-bar-view.js:148:24 <anonymous>
app/node_modules/space-pen/vendor/jquery.js:4676:9 jQuery.event.dispatch
app/node_modules/space-pen/vendor/jquery.js:4360:28 elemData.handle
```

The offending lines in status bar look like this:

``` coffee
updateCursorPositionText: =>
    editor = atom.workspace.getActiveEditor()
    if position = editor?.getCursorBufferPosition()
      @text("#{position.row + 1},#{position.column + 1}").show()
    else
      @hide()
```

This seems to suggest to me that `atom.workspace.getActiveEditor()` is returning an editor with no cursors which might imply that is has been destroyed already.

It would be easy to check for this explicitly in status bar but the fact that `atom.workspace.getActiveEditor()` is return an unusable editor is worrisome.

@nathansobo any thoughts on this?

data.title: Selections do not always disappear immediately, causing overwrites.
data.body:
Occasionally when selecting text and typing over it, the selection remains and selects the next text of the same length (or sometimes one character). Because of this, typing over a selection causes the original text AND the new selection to be overwritten. In the case that the selection is replaced by the one character selection, typing continually replaces the same character until a delay in typing occurs.

The expected behavior is that the selection and selected text both disappear immediately when beginning to type.

Using Atom 0.99 on OS X 10.9.3

data.body:
If I copy the following text "Firmengründer" and paste it to a different line in Atom it will show up as "Firmengr�nder". Same with ® 

Version:
0.100.0-eae33be

data.title: Very high CPU usage
data.body:
I'm going to start this off purposefully thin on details, as hopefully I'll be asked questions about the specifics I can answer without writing up everything I can think of, half of which may be wasted.

I'm running Atom 0.99.0 on a 2.4Ghz i7 MacBook Pro in Mac OS 10.9.3. I started playing around with the mean.io boilerplate node stack a few days ago, and when I'm running the grunt task, Atom Helpers are completely spanking my CPU, and the system fan spins up to full speed. I found a few old issues where this was occurring when running a terminal or console from within Atom, but nothing quite like what I'm encountering.

What information will be most useful in determining the root cause of this?

TIA,

Christian

data.title: [OS X] Application doesn't replace colon with slash in file name presented to user
data.body:
##### Steps to reproduce
1. `touch Foo\:Bar.txt`
2. `open -b com.github.atom Foo\:Bar.txt`
3. Inspect opened window
##### Expected result

Application presents file name as `Foo/Bar.txt`
##### Actual result

Application presents file name as `Foo:Bar.txt`
##### Screenshots

Window title:
![Window title](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1595470/3129134/fa810bae-e7de-11e3-9993-0099fe873f18.png)

Tab title:

##### Affected version

0.100.0
##### Environment

OS X 10.9.3

data.title: Update os-x.md
data.body:
With the original URL, git would throw this error:

```
fatal: unable to access 'https://github.com/atom/atom/': The requested URL returned error: 500
```

data.title: Atom dev's short term initiatives
Basic Windows support for devs
data.body:
Our initial plan is to grease the path for developers to get atom for windows. This is a short term plan with the ultimate, long-term goal being an installer and auto-updater for everyone. 

**Short term**
- [x] Specs passing #2446
- [x] CI running and stable #2444
- [x] Fix various build issues 
- [x] Installable via chocolatey
- [x] A zip file in releases

data.title: Get specs passing on Windows
data.body: Currently specs do not pass on Windows machines.

data.title: Log config parsing errors as errors, not warnings
data.body:
I'm not sure what happened. I installed a plugin (pep8 python linter), I tried to configure it. The next time I opened atom it went back to the default settings. Anything in my config.cson is not being used. Even when I manually make changes in the settings pane, they aren't being set. 

ideas on how to trouble shoot this?

Thanks

data.title: Setup CI for Windows
data.body:
Right now, everyone but Mac users seem to be having a difficult time getting Atom to build. And the lack of official binaries is also problematic.

CI needs to be setup for all supported builds, or at least add Windows since that is likely to be one of the more popular platforms. Having CI setup for all supported builds would also help the project stay on top of build problems and out-dated build instructions.

data.title: Line number showing double on soft wrap
data.body:
Sometimes when having long lines and using soft wrap, the line number is repeated instead of showing a dot (this happens with line 26 in the first screenshot). The line numbers are correct (so the line displayed as 26 is line 26 and 27 starts where it should) and the content shows fine. Also, the markup seems fine as far as I can tell (see second screenshot). 

The issue might be related to #2429

data.title: Context menus that use the`.overlayer` selector don't work
data.body: Since the `.overlayer` div doesn't exist anymore, the context menus for packages like spell-check don't work in the react editor.

data.title: Linux build: Error on saving
data.body:
I get the following error in my console when trying to save a file - 

```
Uncaught Error: spawn ENOENT util.js:682
exports._errnoException util.js:682
ChildProcess._handle.onexit child_process.js:857
(anonymous function) child_process.js:1005
_tickCallback node.js:605
```

The dev tools also popup on save (but perhaps this is just to show me the error - not sure if that's desired behaviour or not).

I'm running a build created from commit `befedac5462b1286cf686b52eb5d0def1ef9327f` (HEAD of master yesterday) on Linux Mint 14 (more version info below)

```
DISTRIB_ID=LinuxMint
DISTRIB_RELEASE=14
DISTRIB_CODENAME=nadia
DISTRIB_DESCRIPTION="Linux Mint 14 Nadia"
NAME="Ubuntu"
VERSION="12.10, Quantal Quetzal"
ID=ubuntu
ID_LIKE=debian
PRETTY_NAME="Ubuntu quantal (12.10)"
VERSION_ID="12.10"
```

Other possibly relevant info: NodeJS version 0.10.28, npm version 1.4.9.

data.title: Properly classify your editor in your DEBIAN/control
data.body: There is no section called "devel" in Ubuntu/Debian as it's called development but I think under the descriptions for sections classified in Ubuntu/Debian it would be much more prudent to place it under the section "editors" with a secondary on "development" if it pleases `apt`.

data.title: Follow FHS when building packages for Linux.
data.body: As it stands right now you place your `.so` and `javascript` files inside of `/usr/share/atom` which is a violation of the FHS IMO, even if it's pretty broad on the explanation to you the FHS further defines what `/usr/lib` is intended for: http://www.pathname.com/fhs/pub/fhs-2.3.html#USRLIBLIBRARIESFORPROGRAMMINGANDPA

data.title: access atom packages functionality from the developer tools console
data.body: is this hard to do? are there any examples? thanks in advance

data.title: chmod build for deb or build in place instead of /tmp
data.body:
The assumption of your build scripts is that all people use the default insecure permissions provided by Ubuntu but this is not true, quite a few of us default all user `umask`'s to `0077` and use `getfacl` and `setfacl` to adjust per directory permissions inside of the home directory, this results in dpkg going nuts unless you adjust the `umask` ahead of time which is fair enough for programmers and systems experts but if you plan to build a one-stop shop for building atom please consider taking into consideration consistency enforcement to prevent silly `dpkg-deb` errors.

There are several options here in my opinion:
- Set the `umask` before you even get started.
- Build in place and use `setfacl` on a custom tmp folder inside of the build directory.
- `chmod` everything.

If you guys provide me with your preference I'd be more than happy to send a pull addressing this issue and providing quite a bit of system consistency enforcement for your Debian build scripts.

data.title: Install npm in build folder on CI
data.body:
Builds are failing again due to npm `1.3` being on CI.

This PR make sure npm `1.4+` will be preinstalled and used by `script/bootstrap`.

data.title: Use tokenized event to determine tab style
data.body:
`TokenizedBuffer` (and `DisplayBuffer`) now emit a `tokenized` event once a buffer is fully tokenized. They also emit a `tokenized` event when the buffer's grammar changes and is re-tokenized.

`Editor` uses this event as a trigger to determine if a file should use hard or soft tabs. The tokenization event is needed because comments at the top of a file may contain different tab styles than the code and should not be used to determine the tab state. This information is only available after the buffer is tokenized.

Closes #2421

data.title: Lines sometimes duplicated or not removed
data.body:
Check this. Line 71 is repeated several times. Note that there are a bunch of `data-screen-row="70"` in the inspector.

![screen shot 2014-05-28 at 3 18 13 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/69169/3111825/2ab287c8-e6b6-11e3-9798-1172a052a9a5.png)

Scrolling cleans up these old lines and brings it back to normal.

I am not sure what causes it to get in this situation yet. @nathansobo if you have things I should try or dump, lemmie know.

This happens probably once or twice for every hour of work I do.
